raw_text:
I'll extract the structured information about this graduation program study in Niger.

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": "Multi-faceted Aid for the Very Poor: Evidence from Niger",
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "Niger Cash Transfer Program",
    "country": "Niger",
    "region": "Dosso, Maradi, Tahoua, Tillaberi and Zinder regions",
    "target_population": "Very poor households",
    "program_name_citation": "The Niger cash transfer program has relatively large geographical scope, which contributes to external validity of the study findings. In total, approximately 100,000 households have participated in the Niger cash transfer program since 2012.",
    "country_citation": "The study focuses on the 3rd wave of the program, which reached 22,507 beneficiary households in 329 villages in 17 communes (counties) of the five most populous of Niger's eight regions (Dosso, Maradi, Tahoua, Tillaberi and Zinder)",
    "target_population_citation": "The program eligibility threshold is below the poverty line, and can be considered closer to an extreme poverty line. About 80 percent of households are below the poverty line in program areas, but approximately the poorest half of them is covered by the program."
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "lump-sum cash grant",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": "one-time",
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "The first treatment variant also includes a lump-sum cash grant (similar to the asset transfer in a traditional graduation program)"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["agricultural assets", "business assets"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "We find strong impacts of three variants of a multi-faceted social protection program on consumption and food security six and 18 months post-intervention. These welfare improvements are consistent with large observed increases in earnings from women-led income-generating activities, in particular off-farm self-employment and livestock."
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "consumption/expenditure",
      "food security/nutrition",
      "income/earnings",
      "asset accumulation",
      "women's empowerment",
      "psychological well-being",
      "social cohesion"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We document strong impacts of three variants of a multi-faceted social protection program on consumption and food security six and 18 months post-intervention. These welfare improvements are consistent with large observed increases in earnings from women-led income-generating activities, in particular off-farm self-employment and livestock. Savings and asset accumulation also increase. We find substantial impacts across several dimensions of psychological and social well-being.",
    "study_design": "Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT)",
    "design_evidence_citation": "The study is a cluster-randomized controlled trial in which villages with existing cash transfer beneficiaries were randomly allocated to one of the four arms -one control group and three treatment arms with variants of the intervention package.",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2016-2020",
    "sample_size": 4712,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "Program costs: $263 PPP for psychosocial package, $482 PPP for capital package, $584 PPP for full package",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "The program costs ($ 263 PPP for the psychosocial package, $ 482 PPP for the capital package and $ 584 PPP for the full package) are substantially lower than similar graduation programs implemented in other contexts"
  }
}
```
